text: Hello everyone , not sure if i'm in the right channel. But I want to have contact to contact association but I can't find a suitable solution without creating an intermediate custom object.. If anyone has already tried somrthing and it worked please share with us :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks a lot !

Hi, I have a question with regards to reCaptcha and bot related spam-prevention: Apparently, HubSpot does not offer a really good instance to prevent bots from submitting forms. We have seen an increase in bot submissions which is obviously not what anyone wants. I read that there might be few workarounds, including creating a property field for the form where a user needs to do a simple match calculation. Another way would be using code (which is not really an option for us) and thirdly, to create a hidden field with a specific logic. This field would then only be visible for bots and not humans and once filled out by a bot, the logic would prevent the form from being submitted. If anyone knows how to create the third option, that would be immensely appreciated :)
I've done that third option in the past, check this out: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PU4LV8/p1667670409353139>

Hey Carter, thanks for your response :slightly_smiling_face: I read the thread of that specific case you are referring to and it seems to be as if you only make the form field invisible by using some CSS. However, the question remains how to prevent the form submission if this hidden field is triggered/filled out by a bot. I could not find anything on how to combine the hidden field with some logic that would stop bots from submitting the form once the hidden field is filled out. Tbh I am not even sure if this whole "honeypot" thing is actually possible in HubSpot. The more I think about the more issues arise: 1: For example, even if I make a field hidden, the bots do not need to fill it out unless it is required - but even if the field is made invisible for a human, how can the form then be submitted if it is a required field? 2: and also, how to link the field with a logic so that once filled out by a bot it cannot be submitted. So, just to be clear (I know my message might be bit confusing), these are are mainly the 2 questions that I have to solve this bot submission problem.

• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs

You don't do the logic on the frontend you allow submissions that have text in the hidden field but you filter out or delete all of them using a workflow or view
Oh I see, I assumed that there would be at least some sort of logic option in HubSpot.
Nope this is very much a custom solution
ReCaptcha is the only built in option that HubSpot provides
Heads up! We just created an <#C0558GU8H2M|ai> channel for anyone wanting to discuss anything to do with AI, AI and HubSpot, etc!

Hey guys, I am trying to retrieve a list of all records from an object. In this case, Contacts.

I have over 100 contacts but when I send the API call, it only returns 10 contacts to me every time.

How do we override this?

Hello everyone!
Does someone know if there is anything similar to timeline, webhook or something that I could listen to WHEN an page or a post is created/updated?
There's currently an Alpha for this.
